title: AC blowing warm air only
symptoms: Fan runs but air from vents is not cold
Outdoor unit may or may not run
recommended_actions: Set thermostat to Cool and lowest temperature and wait 5–10 minutes
Check outdoor unit: is the fan and compressor running?
Clean outdoor coil with gentle water spray (power off first)
If compressor never starts or lines stay warm, licensed HVAC tech must check refrigerant and compressor

title: AC not turning on at all
symptoms: Thermostat screen blank or unresponsive
No noise from indoor or outdoor units
possible_causes: Blown low-voltage fuse on control board
Float switch tripped due to clogged drain
recommended_actions: Check main electrical panel and reset tripped breakers once
Replace thermostat batteries if present
Inspect condensate drain line for clogs; clear if overflowing
If breaker re-trips or nothing happens, call HVAC technician

title: Weak airflow from vents
symptoms: Some cooling but rooms take very long to cool
Air barely felt from vents
recommended_actions: Replace or clean air filter immediately
Open all supply and return vents
Check furniture or curtains blocking vents
If still weak, blower assembly may need cleaning by a pro

title: AC freezing up (ice on pipes or indoor coil)
symptoms: Ice on copper lines near outdoor or indoor unit
Little or no airflow
Unit may shut off then drip water when ice melts
possible_causes: Thermostat set too low in cool weather
recommended_actions: Turn system off and let ice completely melt
Replace filter and ensure vents are open
Restart and monitor; if icing returns, tech must check refrigerant and blower

title: Water leaking from indoor unit
symptoms: Water around air handler or ceiling stains near vent
AC may still cool
recommended_actions: Turn system off to prevent ceiling damage
Use wet/dry vacuum on outside drain line to clear blockage
If leak persists, technician should inspect pan and slope

title: Bad smell when AC runs
symptoms: Musty or moldy odor from vents
Smell stronger after unit has been off for a while
possible_causes: Mold growth on coil or in drain pan
Animals or dead rodents in ducts (rare but possible)
recommended_actions: Replace filter and run fan-only mode for a while
Have coils and drain pan cleaned by HVAC professional
If odor is burning or electrical, turn off power immediately

title: Outdoor unit noisy or rattling
symptoms: Rattling, clanking, or grinding noises
Noise increases when compressor starts
recommended_actions: Turn power off before inspecting
Remove leaves or debris carefully
Tighten any loose screws on panels
If grinding persists, compressor or fan motor may need service

title: Thermostat shows cooling but room stays hot
symptoms: Thermostat appears normal
No cold air at vents or system short cycles
possible_causes: Thermostat located in wrong place (direct sun or draft)
recommended_actions: Set thermostat to Hold or permanent cool mode
Disable schedules temporarily to test
If unit runs but still does not cool, mechanical issue is more likely than thermostat

title: Breaker trips when AC starts
symptoms: Breaker trips immediately or within seconds
Outdoor unit hums or fails to start
recommended_actions: Do not keep resetting breaker
Turn system off and call HVAC electrician
Compressor or wiring likely needs professional diagnosis

title: AC short cycling (turns on and off frequently)
symptoms: Runs for 1–5 minutes then stops, repeats often
Room never reaches set temperature
recommended_actions: Ensure thermostat not directly in path of cold air
Check filter and coils for ice
If short cycling continues, technician should inspect pressures and safeties

title: Window AC dripping water inside room
symptoms: Water dripping from front panel
Back of unit may be higher than front
recommended_actions: Adjust installation so rear of unit is slightly lower than front
Clear drain channels and holes carefully
Make sure filter is clean

title: AC fan runs but compressor silent
symptoms: Outdoor fan spinning
No change in pipe temperature
No cooling inside
recommended_actions: Turn off power to avoid overheating
HVAC tech should test capacitor and compressor windings
Do not attempt to bypass safeties

title: AC smells like burning plastic
symptoms: Sharp hot smell from vents or unit
May occur when system first turns on
possible_causes: Dust burning off electric heater strips
recommended_actions: If smell disappears quickly at first use in winter, dust burn-off may be normal
If smell is strong or with smoke, turn system off and call professional immediately

title: Uneven cooling between rooms
symptoms: Some rooms too cold, others hot
System seems to run normally
recommended_actions: Open vents fully in warm rooms and slightly close in overly cold rooms
Check for blocked returns and supplies
If problem severe, HVAC pro can adjust dampers or evaluate duct design

title: High energy bills with AC use
symptoms: Electric bill much higher than usual
AC seems to run constantly
recommended_actions: Perform full maintenance: filter, coil cleaning, drain cleaning
Seal windows and doors to reduce heat gain
Consider professional tune-up and long-term replacement plan

title: AC indoor blower not running
symptoms: Outdoor unit runs and gets cold
No air from vents
recommended_actions: Turn system off to avoid freezing coil
Check filter and ensure no ice on coil
HVAC pro should test motor, capacitor, and board

title: Thermostat changes temperature by itself
symptoms: Setpoint resets to default
System turns off at unexpected times
possible_causes: Smart thermostat controlled by app or automation
recommended_actions: Disable schedules or set to Hold/Manual mode
Replace batteries
Check any phone apps or voice assistants linked to thermostat

title: Mini-split indoor unit leaking water
symptoms: Water dripping from wall unit
Stain on wall below
recommended_actions: Turn off unit and place towel below
Have technician clear drain and verify line slope
Check filter and coil condition

title: AC making high-pitched whistling sound
symptoms: Whistling from vents or return grille
Sound changes when doors open
possible_causes: Filter too restrictive or very dirty
recommended_actions: Use correct type of filter and keep it clean
Ensure doors to main return rooms are open
Open vents more fully to reduce pressure

title: AC outdoor fan not spinning but hums
symptoms: You hear humming from outdoor unit
Fan blades still
Pipes may be very hot
recommended_actions: Turn power off immediately to avoid motor damage
Do not attempt to spin fan by hand with power on (dangerous)
HVAC tech should replace capacitor or motor as needed
